summary: This is the official Notice of Death for Jeffrey Epstein, documenting his death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan on August 10, 2019. The document records the initial report of a possible hanging, the scene investigation, and the classification of the case as 'High Profile' with an undetermined manner of death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death notice; a 66-year-old male who died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at 170 William Street, New York, NY.

persons.name: Pitters, Sheril
persons.context: Listed in the case notes, likely the Medical Examiner or investigator assigned to the death scene.

persons.name: Cannata
persons.context: Mentioned in the communications notes as 'LT. Cannata', associated with the initial call reporting the death location.

connections.description: Sheril Pitters is listed as the investigator on the 'ME Case' for Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan. The initial report indicated a 'possible hanging'. The time of pronouncement was 07:36.

events.title: Scene Investigation Initiated
events.description: The death was classified as a 'ME Case' and 'High Profile'. A Medical Legal Investigator (MLI) was assigned and arrived at the scene at 10:53 for investigation.

locations: 170 William Street, New York, NY 10038 (Metropolitan Correctional Center - MCC, Place of Death)
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital (Facility where death was pronounced)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at 170 William Street, New York, NY.
The initial circumstances reported were a 'possible hanging' and the manner of death was listed as 'Undetermined'.
The case was immediately classified as 'High Profile', with notes indicating a hold was requested and the MLI was unable to give details due to the profile.
The time sequence shows the death was reported at 08:31, assigned for investigation by 09:53, and declared a 'ME Case' by 10:04 on the same day.
